entry.title: Tove Jansson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that artist Tove Jansson (pictured) based the children's book character Snufkin on a political philosopher whom she had dated?

entry.title: St James the Less, Pockthorpe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the church of St James the Less, Pockthorpe, now the home of the Norwich Puppet Theatre, once contained a rood screen with portraits of saints painted in 1479?

entry.title: Sagyo Thu-Myat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Burmese Buddhist monk Sagyo Thu-Myat successfully lobbied for the recalibration of the Burmese calendar?

entry.title: Hicklin Lake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that artificial islands were deployed in Hicklin Lake in an unsuccessful attempt to stop eutrophication?

entry.title: Lee Sung Jin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a COVID-19 bout forced Beef creator Lee Sung Jin to direct the show's season finale remotely?

entry.title: Wooden Warrior (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that elementary school students named the Wooden Warrior roller coaster?

entry.title: Dean Crawford (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Olympic gold medalist Dean Crawford was introduced to rowing when he found a rowing shell outside the students' union building at the University of Victoria?

entry.title: New Zealand threepence (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the patu clubs on the New Zealand threepence were compared to bottles of ginger beer?
